Don't drive through flood water!  
1. Just 30cm can float an average family-sized car 
2. It's the #1 cause of death during flooding 
3. Over ¬æ of cars rescued from floods have to be written off 
4. Just 1 egg-cup of water sucked into your engine will wreck it

tweets.text:
@Tanya_Isaiah @KenGoodwinITV @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyMids Agree with most of that (not dredging on our rivers).

And we are investing large amounts of money and resource with our partners in natural flood management locally. Here‚Äôs some examples from Herefordshire & Worcestershire. 

https://t.co/PWiqavs7B9

https://t.co/YTqu1Dosa6

@DaveThroupEA @KenGoodwinITV @EnvAgency @EnvAgencyNW @EnvAgencyMids ....People & wildlife/environment. Something needs to change, barriers alone are not working, it‚Äôs only getting wetter & the EA should be making things better. Enough budget to be creative/proactive for sure!

@EnvAgencyAnglia @EarthlyIdeas @theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @jamesowild @BurnhamDeepdale @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke So you‚Äôre allowing sewerage to run into the harbour that has a shellfish industry and the lays are up the same end as this pumping station? Really?

@theexterminato9 @AnglianWater @alex_green84 @EarthlyIdeas @jamesowild @EnvAgencyAnglia @EnvAgency @mrnathannelson @BrancasterNT @StaitheSmoke It happens regularly, but according to @AnglianWater  spokes lady today it is a 1 in 100 year event, yet it happened last year in February with the storms, and happens most times we have downpours.
@RichardJFollett @PangColl @EnvAgencySE @BritishRowing If there is any help required with #flooding do get in touch with @Khalsa_Aid! They have sand, sandbags, snacks and volunteers!
@CarolynOtley @TheKingsFund @CumbriaCC @Cumbriapolice @allerdale @CumbriaFire @EnvAgencyNW @PsychologyNTU @hill_rowenahill @DrSallyAndrews NOW that‚Äôs what I call best practice!

Do you like Great Crested Newts?! ü¶é do you like ponds and are you in north #yorkshire?  If yes, would you like @YorksWildlife to install #GCN pond habitat in your park, garden or land for FREE?? If you‚Äôre interested please pm new for more details. @NewtPartnership https://t.co/MudCc8PCFS

@Selyst @TheKingsFund @CumbriaCC @Cumbriapolice @allerdale @CumbriaFire @EnvAgencyNW @PsychologyNTU @hill_rowenahill @DrSallyAndrews And it‚Äôs not always possible, so worth thinking about and developing the skills to build relationships quickly?

There's still time to sign up for this Friday's free online event - please see the @CLANorth tweet highlighted below - our very own Jackie Hamer, Senior Environment Officer will be one of the presenters https://t.co/RShct6JFxj

#Wetlands and #wetwoodland matter; they can help  alleviate flooding, droughts and pollution. 

Here are some measures recently completed on the Upper River Roch to naturally slow the flow.

The Joint Unit for #WasteCrime continues to crack down on criminals dumping waste illegally.

Recently, their investigations in the Midlands discovered waste illegally buried, which also posed a risk to the local environment.

Arrests were made and investigations continue. https://t.co/gj36MNph1w

urls.title: Enforcement partnership nets dishonest game angler a conviction for illegally fishing on the River Exe - Angling Trust
urls.description: ¬† A game angler reported three times by a volunteer bailiff for fishing illegally has been ordered to pay fines and costs totalling ¬£419 and had his fishing tackle confiscated and destroyed. James Robert Lee, from Devon, appeared at Exeter Magistrates Court to face three charges of unlawfully attempting to take fish contrary to schedule [‚Ä¶]

tweets.text: A game angler has been convicted of fishing illegally following great partnership work involving an Angling Trust Volunteer Bailiff in support of @DCPoliceRural_D, @DC_Police and @DCFishEA ‚Äì Always make sure you have a valid @EnvAgency fishing licence - https://t.co/Tm1oL5iWjG

CHC have completed the installation of a 3 tier screen in Woodnook water, Accrington in challenging winter conditions as part of the @EnvAgencyNW Framework.

The screen will help protect the centre of Accrington from flooding for many years to come. https://t.co/kZUMmH3XAc

Proud to see the PM praise the work of @EnvAgency staff in #PMQs today. Our thoughts are with those who have flooded over the past few weeks. Thanks again to all of #teamEA who work around the clock to protect communities from flooding https://t.co/SSEvytl8Sa https://t.co/ZdNtG0lu06

tweets.text:
Would you use your bin as a toilet?

According to the Collins Dictionary:

üóëA bin is a container that you put rubbish in.

üöΩA toilet is a large bowl...which you use when you want to get rid of urine or faeces from your body.

It's really that simple.

#BinTheWipe
